frame.name: Money
frame.definition:
<def-root><fen>Money</fen> is a medium used for exchanging goods and services. It is in most cases issued by a government (its <fen>Creator</fen>) in the form of coins and banknotes. Particular amounts of it may have a designated or planned <fen>Use</fen>, or may have come from some <fen>Origin</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="mon"><t>money</t></fex> <fex name="Use">for our daughter's college education</fex> is currently earning interest in a savings account.</ex>
<ex>The entire project ended up being funded with <fex name="cre">Swiss</fex> <fex name="mon"><t>funds</t></fex>.</ex>
<ex>The use of <fex name="Material">paper</fex> <fex name="mon"><t>money</t></fex> really caught on in Europe in the 1700s</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is used as a medium of exchange.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The use for which the <fen>Money</fen> is intended or designed.</def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>The government (or possibly other organization) that mints, issues and guarantees the legal use of the <fen>Money</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which an <fen>Money</fen> comes into existence or begins to be circulated.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to the <fen>Money</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Money</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition:
<def-root>The process or means by which the <t>Money</t> comes to be possessed.
<ex>It turns out that the company used <fex name="ori">drug</fex> <fex name="mon"><t>money</t></fex> to develop this regionv</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Possessor</fen> has control over the use the <fen>Money</fen>.
<ex>They managed to scam him out of most of <fex name="pos">his</fex> <fex name="mon"><t>cash</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: money.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes.

lexUnit.name: cash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: money in coins or notes.

lexUnit.name: capital.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: wealth owned by a person or organization or invested, lent, or borrowed.

lexUnit.name: sterling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: money, esp. in the U.K.
